item.source: [PI]Losing PKP ONLY if a player killed you[PI]

item.title: [PI]Losing PKP ONLY if a player killed you[PI]
item.dc:creator: @minikiller minikiller
item.description:
@minikiller wrote:

Mendorphins:

Post where you put the code and what the complete error says.

public void applyDead() {
    String message;
    int loss;
    c.respawnTimer = 15;
    c.isDead = false;
     
    if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
        //c.killerId = c.getCombat().getKillerId(c.playerId);
        c.killerId = findKiller();
        Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId];
        if(o != null) {
        [b]if(Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId] != Server.npcHandler.npcs[c.killerId])
        	   continue;
        	else
        	    return;[/b]
            if (c.killerId != c.playerId) {
                if (c.pkPoints == 1) {
                    loss = (c.pkPoints - 1);
                    message = "@red@You lost 1 PK Point. This was your last.";
                } else if (c.pkPoints >= 2) {
                    loss = (c.pkPoints - 2);
                    message = "@red@You lost 2 PK Points.";
                } else {
                    loss = (c.pkPoints - 2);
                    message = "@red@You been defeated by " +o.playerName + "!";
                }
                o.pkPoints = (o.pkPoints + 4);
                o.sendMessage("You gain 4 PK Points for defeating " +c.playerName + "!");
                o.kills = (o.kills + 1);
                c.deaths = (c.deaths + 1);
                c.pkPoints = loss;
                c.sendMessage(message);
            }
            c.playerKilled = c.playerId;
            if(o.duelStatus == 5) {
                o.duelStatus++;
            }
        }
        c.faceUpdate(0);
        c.npcIndex = 0;
        c.playerIndex = 0;
        c.stopMovement();
        if(c.duelStatus <= 4) {
            c.sendMessage("Oh dear you are dead!");
        } else if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
            c.sendMessage("You have lost the duel!");
        }
        resetDamageDone();
        c.specAmount = 10;
        c.getItems().addSpecialBar(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]);
        c.lastVeng = 0;
        c.vengOn = false;
        resetFollowers();
        c.attackTimer = 10;
        if(c.pkPoints < 0){
            c.pkPoints = 0;
        }
    }
}

item.title: [PI]Losing PKP ONLY if a player killed you[PI]
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Because your public void applyDead makes you lose a point when you die, whether it NPC or player, so you got to define that when you are in combat with an NPC that pkPoints - 1 = false.

That is what you was asking in the first place, wasn’t it?

item.title: [PI]Losing PKP ONLY if a player killed you[PI]
item.dc:creator: @minikiller minikiller
item.description:
@minikiller wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][code=Java]
public void applyDead() {
String message;
int loss;
c.respawnTimer = 15;
c.isDead = false;

if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
    //c.killerId = c.getCombat().getKillerId(c.playerId);
    c.killerId = findKiller();
    Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId];
    if(o != null) {
        if (c.killerId != c.playerId) {
            if (c.pkPoints == 1) {
                loss = (c.pkPoints - 1);
                message = "@red@You lost 1 PK Point. This was your last.";
            } else if (c.pkPoints >= 2) {
                loss = (c.pkPoints - 2);
                message = "@red@You lost 2 PK Points.";
            } else {
                loss = (c.pkPoints - 2);
                message = "@red@You been defeated by " +o.playerName + "!";
            }
            o.pkPoints = (o.pkPoints + 4);
            o.sendMessage("You gain 4 PK Points for defeating " +c.playerName + "!");
            o.kills = (o.kills + 1);
            c.deaths = (c.deaths + 1);
            c.pkPoints = loss;
            c.sendMessage(message);
        }
        c.playerKilled = c.playerId;
        if(o.duelStatus == 5) {
            o.duelStatus++;
        }
    }
    c.faceUpdate(0);
    c.npcIndex = 0;
    c.playerIndex = 0;
    c.stopMovement();
    if(c.duelStatus <= 4) {
        c.sendMessage("Oh dear you are dead!");
    } else if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
        c.sendMessage("You have lost the duel!");
    }
    resetDamageDone();
    c.specAmount = 10;
    c.getItems().addSpecialBar(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]);
    c.lastVeng = 0;
    c.vengOn = false;
    resetFollowers();
    c.attackTimer = 10;
    if(c.pkPoints < 0){
        c.pkPoints = 0;
    }
}

[/code][/quote]
wow omg thanks you SO MUCH!!! ILU! :D:D:D:D:D:D

Read full topic

Ahh, I understand now. Yes, just like Vain just said, a boolean check to see if you’re in combat with an NPC or a player.

Vain is obviously more experienced, so I’ll leave it at that.

item.dc:creator: @minikiller minikiller
item.description:
@minikiller wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][code=java]
public void applyDead() {
c.respawnTimer = 15;
c.isDead = false;

if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
    //c.killerId = c.getCombat().getKillerId(c.playerId);
    c.killerId = findKiller();
    Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId];
    if(o != null) {
        if (c.killerId != c.playerId) {
            if (c.pkPoints == 1) {
                loss = (c.pkPoints - 1);
                message = "@red@You lost 1 PK Point. This was your last.";
            } else if (c.pkPoints >= 2) {
                loss = (c.pkPoints - 2);
                message = "@red@You lost 2 PK Points.";
            } else {
                loss = ();
                message = "@red@You been defeated by " +o.playerName + "!";
            }
            o.pkPoints = (o.pkPoints + 4);
            o.sendMessage("You gain 4 PK Points for defeating " +c.playerName + "!");
            o.kills = (o.kills + 1);
            c.deaths = (c.deaths + 1);
            c.pkPoints = loss;
            c.sendMessage(message);
        }
        c.playerKilled = c.playerId;
        if(o.duelStatus == 5) {
            o.duelStatus++;
        }
    }
    c.faceUpdate(0);
    c.npcIndex = 0;
    c.playerIndex = 0;
    c.stopMovement();
    if(c.duelStatus <= 4) {
        c.sendMessage("Oh dear you are dead!");
    } else if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
        c.sendMessage("You have lost the duel!");
    }
    resetDamageDone();
    c.specAmount = 10;
    c.getItems().addSpecialBar(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]);
    c.lastVeng = 0;
    c.vengOn = false;
    resetFollowers();
    c.attackTimer = 10;
    if(c.pkPoints < 0){
        c.pkPoints = 0;
    }
}

[/code]
Not sure if you missed a bracket when pasting a void, or if there’s extra code or not, but the method isn’t closed yet. You need an extra bracket ad the end, so check that if you get any errors.

@Topic; forgot, you need to make a boolean to check if not in a fight with NPC.[/quote]

I get errors at:

loss = (c.pkPoints - 1); message = "@red@You lost 1 PK Point. This was your last."; } else if (c.pkPoints >= 2) { loss = (c.pkPoints - 2); message = "@red@You lost 2 PK Points."; } else { loss = ();
Errors at loss and message. The last message after loss = (); is fine. (havent quoted it)

item.title: [PI]Losing PKP ONLY if a player killed you[PI]
item.dc:creator: @minikiller minikiller
item.description:
@minikiller wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][code=Java]
public void applyDead() {
c.respawnTimer = 15;
c.isDead = false;

if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
    //c.killerId = c.getCombat().getKillerId(c.playerId);
    c.killerId = findKiller();
    Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId];
    if(o != null) {
        if (c.killerId != c.playerId) {
            if (c.pkPoints == 1) {
                loss = (c.pkPoints - 1);
                message = "@red@You lost 1 PK Point. This was your last.";
            } else if (c.pkPoints >= 2) {
                loss = (c.pkPoints - 2);
                message = "@red@You lost 2 PK Points.";
            } else {
                loss = ();
                message = "@red@You been defeated by " +o.playerName + "!";
            }
            o.pkPoints = (o.pkPoints + 4);
            o.sendMessage("You gain 4 PK Points for defeating " +c.playerName + "!");
            o.kills = (o.kills + 1);
            c.deaths = (c.deaths + 1);
            c.pkPoints = loss;
            c.sendMessage(message);

[/code]
You didn’t post enough of your code, and I had to fix a lot of errors, so you may have trouble adding it.[/quote]

Ok, sorry. This is the FULL method.

public void applyDead() { c.respawnTimer = 15; c.isDead = false; 
	if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
		//c.killerId = c.getCombat().getKillerId(c.playerId);
		c.killerId = findKiller();
		Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId];
		if(o != null) {
			if (c.killerId != c.playerId)
			o.pkPoints = (o.pkPoints + 4);
			o.sendMessage("You gain 4 PK Points for defeating " +c.playerName + "!");
			o.kills = (o.kills + 1);
			c.deaths = (c.deaths + 1);
			c.sendMessage("@red@You been defeated by " +o.playerName + "!");
			if (c.pkPoints == 1);
			c.pkPoints = (c.pkPoints - 1);
			c.sendMessage("@red@You lost 1 PK Point. This was your last.");
			} else if (c.pkPoints >= 2);
			c.pkPoints = (c.pkPoints - 2);
			c.sendMessage("@red@You lost 2 PK Points.");

			
			c.playerKilled = c.playerId;
			if(o.duelStatus == 5) {
				o.duelStatus++;
			}
		} 

	c.faceUpdate(0);
	c.npcIndex = 0;
	c.playerIndex = 0;
	c.stopMovement();
	if(c.duelStatus <= 4) {
		c.sendMessage("Oh dear you are dead!");
	} else if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
		c.sendMessage("You have lost the duel!");
	}
	resetDamageDone();
	c.specAmount = 10;
	c.getItems().addSpecialBar(c.playerEquipment[c.playerWeapon]);
	c.lastVeng = 0;
	c.vengOn = false;
	resetFollowers();
	c.attackTimer = 10;
	if(c.pkPoints < 0){
		c.pkPoints = 0;
		}
}</blockquote>

Thanks for helping me

Mendorphins:

What happens? Do you get any errors? Does nothing happen to the other player once they have died?

It works fine, but if u die by an npc u gain a death and lose pkp xD… I want it to be like only if a player kills u :o

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Losing PKP ONLY if a player killed you[PI]
item.dc:creator: @minikiller minikiller
item.description:
@minikiller wrote:

[quote=“Mendorphins, post:2, topic:369723”]Just a note, you need 15 rep to rep++.

Plus, post a bit more information, like your code. Makes it a bit easier for people to help.[/quote]

public void applyDead() {	
	c.respawnTimer = 15;
	c.isDead = false;
	
	if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
		//c.killerId = c.getCombat().getKillerId(c.playerId);
		c.killerId = findKiller();
		Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId];
		if(o != null) {
			if (c.killerId != c.playerId)
			o.pkPoints = (o.pkPoints + 4);
			o.sendMessage("You gain 4 PK Points for defeating " +c.playerName + "!");
			o.kills = (o.kills + 1);
			c.deaths = (c.deaths + 1);
			c.sendMessage("@red@You been defeated by " +o.playerName + "!");
			if (c.pkPoints == 1);
			c.pkPoints = (c.pkPoints - 1);
			c.sendMessage("@red@You lost 1 PK Point. This was your last.");
			} else if (c.pkPoints >= 2);
			c.pkPoints = (c.pkPoints - 2);
			c.sendMessage("@red@You lost 2 PK Points.");

Read full topic

item.title: [PI]Losing PKP ONLY if a player killed you[PI]
item.dc:creator: @minikiller minikiller
item.description:
@minikiller wrote:

Hey. I need to know how i can make it lose PK Points ONLY if u get killed by a PLAYER… SPOONFEED PLEASE! WILL REP!

This is my code (MESSY):

public void applyDead() { c.respawnTimer = 15; c.isDead = false; 
	if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
		//c.killerId = c.getCombat().getKillerId(c.playerId);
		c.killerId = findKiller();
		Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId];
		if(o != null) {
			if (c.killerId != c.playerId)
			o.pkPoints = (o.pkPoints + 4);
			o.sendMessage("You gain 4 PK Points for defeating " +c.playerName + "!");
			o.kills = (o.kills + 1);
			c.deaths = (c.deaths + 1);
			c.sendMessage("@red@You been defeated by " +o.playerName + "!");
			if (c.pkPoints == 1);
			c.pkPoints = (c.pkPoints - 1);
			c.sendMessage("@red@You lost 1 PK Point. This was your last.");
			} else if (c.pkPoints >= 2);
			c.pkPoints = (c.pkPoints - 2);
			c.sendMessage("@red@You lost 2 PK Points.");</blockquote>
